id: Spice Girls ‘to announce stadium tour in special video message this Monday’ – without Victoria
paragraph: 135.6m sharesGet ready to slam it to the left, shake it to the right, and get all the chicas to the front – because girl power is back, baby.In possibly the most exciting news we’ve had since we were 10, the Spice Girls are apparently set to announce their reunion in just a few days time.Following the news that Mel B, Mel C, Emma Bunton and Geri Horner will be making an appearance on The Jonathan Ross Show on Saturday, 10 November, it has been reported that the girls will be announcing a stadium tour next summer.According to The Sun, the Spice Girls – without Victoria Beckham – have recorded a special video message that will announce a tour across the UK in 2019.The video is expected to be released this Monday, so we’d advise digging out your leopard print and/or Union Jack dresses now.The band – famous for pop classics including Wannabe, Who Do You Think You Are, Say You’ll Be There and Spice Up Your Life – have not performed together since the London Olympics closing ceremony in 2012.They previously reunited in 2007 for a tour which ended in January 2008, but this will be the first time the girls perform as a four-piece without Victoria.Posh, Baby, Scary and Sporty recorded as a quartet after Geri, aka Ginger, left the band in 1998 to go solo.However, this time, it’s Victoria who won’t be joining the band, as she has chosen to concentrate on her fashion business.People aren’t happy the Spice Girls are shunning girl power for people powerSpice Girls get political on Brexit and Mel B laughs: 'I don't live here'Mel C praises Victoria Beckham's Spice Girls nod during People's Choice Award winThis is believed to have caused some bad blood amongst the girls – as evidenced by Mel B’s petty AF Halloween costume at Heidi Klum’s annual party on Wednesday night.The 43-year-old wore a Victoria mask and carried a sign reading ‘No I am not going on tour’, while her friend Gary Madatyan dressed as David Beckham and toted a sign reading ‘Please please please do it for the Spice fans’.Whatever happened to ‘friendship never ends’, eh girls?If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing
